title: Slots developer wants to buy Suffolk Downs land - Massachusetts news
text:
The man pushing for a second slots license in Massachusetts is trying to buy property near Suffolk Downs.
Related Links City files another suit to fight Wynn casino The Death of a Racetrack: How Suffolk Downs Could Have Saved Itself Get today’s headlines right in your inbox The developer Eugene McCain offered millions of dollars for a trailer park and disused bar behind the former horse racing track, The Boston Globe reports. If he’s able to secure a license, this is where he hopes to construct his slots parlor and a luxury hotel to go with it.
 McCain had his fall 2016 ballot question clear attorney general approval last month, but now must collect signatures to set the measure in front of voters. He also faces potential opposition from the Revere mayor. According to the Globe, Mayor Dan Rizzo is OK with a hotel, but against a slots parlor at the former track.
City government is not the only pushback Thailand developer McCain could face . Wynn Resorts, Penn National Gaming, and MGM Resorts all have chips in the Massachusetts gambling pot , and don’t want to see a new face at the table.
Last year Suffolk Downs lost its bid to have a casino developed on the site. The Massachusetts Gaming Commission instead awarded the license to billionaire casino mogul Steve Wynn, who is building his facility on the Mystic Waterfront in Everett. McCain says he wants to develop his gambling facility at Suffolk Downs and support the state’s horseracing industry according to the Globe.
Read the full story at the Globe .
